instructions: Spread butter on the bread slices.
Apply green chutney on the other side of each slice.
Place cucumber, tomato, and onion slices on one bread piece.
Sprinkle salt and pepper on top.
Add cheese slice if desired.
Cover with another bread slice to make the sandwich.
Toast, grill, or serve plain.
Soak rice, dal, and fenugreek seeds overnight, then grind to a smooth batter.
Ferment the batter for 6–8 hours.
Prepare potato filling by sautéing onions, adding turmeric, salt, and mashed potatoes.
Heat a tawa, spread a ladle of batter into a thin dosa.
Place some potato filling inside and fold.
Serve hot with coconut chutney and sambar.
Mix bajra flour with salt.
Slowly add warm water and knead into a soft dough.
Take a portion of dough and flatten by hand into a thick roti.
Cook on a hot tawa until brown spots appear.
Apply ghee and serve hot with garlic chutney or curd.
Roast the brinjal directly on flame until the skin blackens.
Peel the skin and mash the pulp.
Heat oil, sauté onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste, tomatoes, and spices.
Add mashed brinjal and mix well.
Cook for 5–7 minutes and garnish with coriander.
Serve hot with bajra rotlo.
Crush the rotis into a coarse powder.
Heat ghee and melt jaggery in it.
Mix melted jaggery into the crushed roti mixture.
Add sugar, cardamom powder, and dry fruits if desired.
Mix well until everything combines.
Serve warm as a traditional sweet dish.
Mix wheat flour, salt, and ghee; knead into a firm dough.
Shape into medium-sized balls (baati).
Bake or roast baatis until golden and crispy.
Cook mixed dal with turmeric and salt.
Prepare tadka with ghee, cumin seeds, tomatoes, and spices, then mix into dal.
Crush hot baati and pour ghee on top.
Serve with hot dal.
